form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Vitter introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To prohibit the regulation of carbon dioxide emissions in the United States until China, India, and Russia implement similar reductions.

section.header: Carbon dioxide reductions in China, India, and Russia
section.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency or the head of any other Federal agency shall not regulate carbon dioxide emissions until the date on which the Secretary of Commerce certifies in writing that each of the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China, the Republic of India, and Russia have initiated measures that require carbon dioxide emission reductions that are substantially similar to the carbon dioxide emission reductions proposed for the United States.
